CatDescriptText: Sanders Moore, commercial artist, 43 Roberts Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "Definitely, and the reason why is because the were there first. Also, a lot of the businesses weer [sic] forced to leave, therefore they should have priority-- that is if they can afford it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sanders Moore wearing dark zippered jacket with collar and breast pockets, carrying pair of scissors at waist, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower store in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
